artist: Lorna Simpson; Publisher: Peter Norton Family Christmas Projects, Pasadena, California
creditline: Gift of Evan M. Maurer in honor of Denise May
life_date: Lorna Simpson, American, born 1960; Peter Norton Family Christmas Projects, Pasadena, California, Publisher
medium: Wooden box containing three wishbones made of ceramic, rubber and bronze inserted in two felt pads
text: Throughout her career, conceptual artist Lorna Simpson has explored matters of gender, race, and history pertinent to the lived experience of Black Americans. Physicality is often central to her investigations, especially in the presentation and perception of bodily strength and vulnerability. Presented like jewels or relics in a sleek wooden box, these three wishbones materialize the fragility and preciousness of living beings—and of their dreams.
title: III (Three Wishbones in a Wood Box)
